alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mackinac; Mackinac Island, Bois Blanc Island; Western Chippewa; Western Mackinac (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 20 at 11:53AM EDT until June 21 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Eastern Upper Michigan and Northern Lower Michigan, including the following areas, in Eastern Upper Michigan, Eastern Mackinac, Mackinac Island/Bois Blanc Island, Western Chippewa and Western Mackinac. In Northern Lower Michigan, Cheboygan, Emmet and Presque Isle. * WHEN...Until 4 PM EDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - 2.0 to 3.0 inches of rain have fallen this morning, with another 1.0 to 2.0 inches possible the next couple hours. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mackinac; Mackinac Island, Bois Blanc Island; Western Chippewa; Western Mackinac
